content.description: A great warm up climb for the area.  Starts just a few feet to the right of ‘Sundial’ and goes up the face section to the right of the roof.  Walk to the base and scramble up some large debri rocks.  Start on a large flat edge and move up through some easier climbing.  The crux is pulling the bulge roof just a little below the anchors.
content.location: Starts just a few feet to the right of ‘Sundial’

content.description: Starts just below the beginning of the large roof on some good horizontal cracks.  Trend up and left out of the steepness and onto some good face climbing.  You can gain the anchors by either moving left around a bulge mantle which is a little easier, or make a move up and right to find the mantle for the anchors.
content.location: Starts just below the beginning of the large roof on some good horizontal cracks. Left of Sundial by a few feet.

content.description: This climb shares anchors and a bolt with ‘Time Piece’ but starts on the left side of the arete.  Look for the dark streak in the rock about 20 ft. up.  Start under the streak on some good edges and climb into slots along the horizontal crack seam and traverse out right to the beautiful arete.  Make a couple of hard moves up the arete to make way to the anchors.
content.location: This climb shares anchors and a bolt with ‘Time Piece’

content.description: Look for the large flat ledge just a few feet to the right of the cave crack and before the start to ‘Test of Time’.  Move up and right through some decent edges and good ledges to pull the steepness.  A big move after the roof will lead you to the anchors.
content.location: Located just to the right of the cave crack in-between the Trade Wall and Sundial Crag.

climbs.name: Sundial
climbs.fa: FA:  Aaron Parlier; Developed 8/29/2019 Marshall Gilbert

content.description: A super classic and fun route.  Start just a few feet to the right of ‘Time Piece’ under a neat formation of gnarley rock on the face.  Start on some good horizontals to gain a ledge for the first clip.  Continue up the face making a deadpoint move to the horizontal crack under the roof.  Trend up and left to the edge of the roof and work through the large rail and huge diving board feature to gain the anchors above.
content.location: Below the big roof leading to the side of the big roof

content.description: A little further down past the ‘Trade Wall’ you will see a prominent roof coming out to a point.  This is the middle of the Sundial Wall.
